content.text:
# Black Reel Awards of 2003

The 2003 Black Reel Awards, which annually recognize and celebrate the achievements of black people in feature, independent and television films, took place in Washington, D.C., on March 2, 2003. Antwone Fisher took home five awards during the ceremony, with The Rosa Parks Story receiving four awards.
Winners and nominees
Winners are listed first and highlighted in bold.
{| class=wikitable width="100%"
! width="50%"| Best Film
! width="50%"| Best Director
|-
| valign="top" |
* Antwone Fisher
** 25th Hour
** Barbershop
** Drumline
** Standing in the Shadows of Motown
| valign="top" |
* 'Denzel Washington – Antwone Fisher'
** Malcolm D. Lee – Undercover Brother
** Spike Lee – 25th Hour
** Charles Stone III – Drumline
** Tim Story – Barbershop
|-
! width="50%"| Best Actor
! width="50%"| Best Actress
|-
| valign="top" |
* 'Derek Luke – Antwone Fisher'
** Ice Cube – Barbershop
** Samuel L. Jackson – Changing Lanes
** Wesley Snipes – Undisputed
** Denzel Washington – John Q
| valign="top" |
* 'Angela Bassett – Sunshine State'
** Kimberly Elise – John Q
** Aunjanue Ellis – Undercover Brother
** Sanaa Lathan – Brown Sugar
** Thandie Newton – The Truth About Charlie
|-
! width="50%"| Best Supporting Actor
! width="50%"| Best Supporting Actress

* 'Dennis Haysbert – Far from Heaven'

** Viola Davis – Solaris
** Rosario Dawson – 25th Hour

|-

** Mark Brown and Don S. Scott – Barbershop

| valign="top" |
* 'Derek Luke – Antwone Fisher'
** Beyoncé – Austin Powers in Goldmember

** Raven Goodwin – Lovely & Amazing
** Lil' Bow Wow – Like Mike

! width="50%"| Outstanding Original Soundtrack
! width="50%"| Best Original or Adapted Song
|-
| valign="top" |
* Standing in the Shadows of Motown
** 8 Mile
** Barbershop
** Brown Sugar
** Undercover Brother
| valign="top" |
* '"Love of My Life (An Ode to Hip-Hop)" from Brown Sugar – Performed by Erykah Badu and Common'
** "Basketball" from Like Mike – Performed by Lil' Bow Wow, Fabolous and Jermaine Dupri
** "Bring Your Heart" from Brown Sugar – Performed by Angie Stone
** "We Got the Funk" from Undercover Brother – Performed by Snoop Dogg, Fred Wesley and Bootsy Collins
** "Work It Out" from Austin Powers in Goldmember – Performed by Beyoncé
|-

! width="50%"| Outstanding Director in a Television Miniseries or Movie
|-

| valign="top" |

** Julie Dash – The Rosa Parks Story (CBS)
